Author: APT41 AKA HOODOO
Description: Researchers from Google discover a campaign carried out by the Chinese Threat Actor APT41 targeting a Taiwanese media organization.

Author: Ursnif
Description: Researchers from Google’s Mandiant observed a campaign distributing the URSNIF banking trojan from Google Drive

Author: Diceloader
Description: Researchers from Google’s Mandiant observed a campaign distributing the DICELOADER malware from Google Drive
Fake extortionists are piggybacking on data breaches and ransomware incidents, threatening U.S. companies with publishing or selling allegedly stolen data unless they get paid.

Author: 9Near
Description: A threat actor named "9Near" claims to have stolen the personal data of 55 million Thai citizens from an unnamed Government agency.
Target Class: Public admin and defence, social security

Author: D0nut Leaks
Description: Montgomery General Hospital is forced to take its systems offline after it was breached and hit by a ransomware attack.
Alpi Aviation, an Italian aircraft manufacturer, has some customer data dumped in the XSS underground forum.
Western Digital announces that its network has been breached and an unauthorized party gained access to multiple company systems. The statement suggests a possible ransomware attack.
British outsourcing services provider Capita announces that a cyberattack is preventing access to its internal Microsoft Office 365 applications.

Author: North Korean state-backed hacking group? (Labyrinth Collima AKA Lazarus Group, Covellite, UNC4034, Zinc, Nickel Academy)
Target: Multiple organizations in the cryptocurrency sector
Description: Researchers from Kaspersky reveal that some of the victims affected by the 3CX supply chain attack have also had their systems backdoored with Gopuram malware, with the threat actors specifically targeting cryptocurrency companies with this additional malicious payload.

Author: ALPHV AKA BlackCat AKA UNC4466
Description: Researchers from Mandiant observe an ALPHV/BlackCat ransomware affiliate exploiting three vulnerabilities (CVE-2021-27876, CVE-2021-27877 and CVE-2021-27878) impacting the Veritas Backup product for initial access to the target network.
Genova Burns, a mid-sized law firm representing Uber notifies an unknown number of its drivers that sensitive data was exposed and stolen due to a cyber-attack.
The Jefferson County School System discloses it was the victim of a ransomware computer attack during Spring Break.

Author: Black Basta
Description: The Black Basta ransomware gang claims to have breached Corporate Technologies, a US-based IT consultancy and cybersecurity firm.
Researchers from BitDefender discover a phishing campaign impersonating crypto solutions provider Ripple.
Country: AU DE DK IE JP KR UK US ZA

Author: Stormous
Description: The Stormous Ransomware adds Cameron Memorial Community Hospital to their leak site, despite they do not provide any proof of claims.

Author: ALPHV AKA BlackCat AKA UNC4466
Description: Mutual de Seguros de Chile is added to the BlackCat ransomware leak site.
The Palmeiras Club of Brazil is the target of a cyberattack.

The Isaac Regional Council, a local government body in the central Queensland area of Australia, discloses that a ransomware attack targeted its internal systems and resulted in reduced customer service capabilities.
Target Class: Public admin and defence, social security

Description: A hacker returned assets worth $465,000 stolen from Allbridge, taking up the multichain token bridge's offer of a white hat bounty and no legal proceedings. The compensation plan came into place after the hacker drained $573,000 by manipulating Allbridge's swap price function.
One of the major Ethereum MEV bots is targeted in an attack, apparently by one of the blockchain's validators, resulting in the loss of almost $20 million.

Author: Noname 057(16)
Description: The pro-Russia hacker group Noname 057(16) announces to be behind a series of DDoS attacks on the Finnish parliament's website as Finland prepares to join the Nato military alliance at a ceremony in Brussels.
Target Class: Public admin and defence, social security

Author: Noname 057(16)
Target: Personal website of outgoing Finnish PM Sanna Marin
Description: The Noname 057(16) group is also believed to be behind a similar attack on at least one other official website as well as the personal website of outgoing Finnish PM Sanna Marin (SDP).
Target Class: Public admin and defence, social security

Description: eFile.com, an IRS-authorized e-file software service provider used by many for filing their tax returns, has been caught serving JavaScript malware.

Author: Rorschach
Description: Researchers from Check Point discover a new ransomware strain dubbed Rorschach with the fastest encryptor seen so far.

Author: lernaean_hydra0
Description: Researchers from Cisco Talos discover a new version of the Typhon Reborn malware dubbed Typhon Reborn V2 characterized by improvements designed to thwart analysis via anti-virtualization mechanisms.

Author: Rilide
Description: Researchers from Trustwave discover a new malicious browser extension called Rilide, that targets Chromium-based products like Google Chrome, Brave, Opera, and Microsoft Edge in disguise of a fake Google Drive extension advertised via Google Ad.

Author: Qbot AKA Qakbot, Pinkslipbot
Description: Security researchers reveal that the QBot malware is now distributed in phishing campaigns utilizing PDFs and Windows Script Files (WSF) to infect Windows devices.

Date Occurred: From September 2022 until at least February 2023
Author: Mantis (AKA Arid Viper, Desert Falcon, APT-C-23)
Description: Researchers from Symantec/Broadcom discover a new campaign by the Palestinian cyber espionage group Mantis, targeting organizations within the Palestinian territories with updated versions of their custom Arid Gopher and Micropsia backdoors.

Researchers from Sysdig uncover a new form of attack, called “proxyjacking,” in which hackers leverage the Log4j vulnerability to gain initial access to a system or device before selling off its IP information to proxyware services.

Author: LockBit 3.0
Target: KNVB (Governing Body for Soccer in the Netherlands)
Description: KNVB, the governing body for soccer in the Netherlands, discloses that hackers were able to steal the personal information of its employees during a cyberattack. The LockBit ransomware gangs claims responsibility for the attack.

Author: Anonymous Sudan
Description: The web site of Check Point, one of Israel's largest cybersecurity companies, is taken down by Anonymous Sudan.

Author: Anonymous Sudan
Target: Websites of multiple major universities in Israel
Description: The websites of multiple major universities in Israel, including Tel Aviv University, the Hebrew University of Jerusalem, Ben-Gurion University of the Negev, Haifa University, Weizmann Institute of Science, Open University of Israel and Reichman University, are taken down by Anonymous Sudan.
Researchers from Checkmarx reveal that a threat actor launched multiple campaigns exploiting the npm registry to deliver malware and crypto scams.

Author: TurkHackTeam
Target: Banks and Government Agencies in Denmark
Description: In name of OpDenmark, a group of Turkish hacktivists dubbed TurkHackTeam defaces several Banks and Government agencies in Denmark.
The personal information of more than 2,000 TAFE SA students is stolen in a serious data breach, when the South Australia police finds a USB drive containing students' data.

Author: Threat actors from Romania
Description: Researchers from Tehtris discover a cryptojacking campaign targeting Linux machines, dubbed Color1337, and involving the use of a bot called uhQCCSpB that installs and launches a Monero miner on the infected machine.

Author: UAC-0145
Description: The Computer Emergency Response Team of Ukraine (CERT-UA) reveals that an Ukrainian utility company was breached with the DarkCrystal after installing a pirated version of Microsoft Office downloaded from a torrent website.

Author: D0nut Leaks
Description: UnitedLex, a legal consulting firm, is hit by the D0nut ransomware gang.

Author: Royal
Description: Researchers from Red Sense reveal that the Royal ransomware group appears to have targeted more than 1,000 organizations with a social engineering attack designed to trick victims into trusting the attackers, and installing ransomware.

Author: LockBit 3.0
Description: The LockBit 3.0 ransomware gang claims to have breached Errebielle, an Italian company specialized in the production of doors and furniture accessories, and dumps 34 gb of data.
YouTube warns users of a new phishing scam that has been using authentic email addresses to lure users into giving away their login credentials.

Author: ARCHIPELAGO
Target: Government and military personnel, think thanks, policy makers, academics, and researchers in South Korea, and the U.S.
Description: Researchers from Google warn of the North Korea-linked ARCHIPELAGO (subset of the APT43 group) targeting government and military personnel, think tanks, policy makers, academics, and researchers in South Korea, the US and elsewhere.

Researchers from Palo Alto Networks reveal that crypto users in Portugal are being targeted by a new malware codenamed CryptoClippy that's capable of stealing cryptocurrency as part of a SEO poisoning malvertising campaign in theme with searches for 'WhatsApp Web'.
The Israel Postal Company detects a cyber attack from a "hostile party" targeting their computer servers, and shuts down part of its computer systems in response to the attack.
Target Class: Public admin and defence, social security

Author: Rektengle
Description: Attackers post an ad on a mostly Russian-speaking hacker forum, putting on sale a database allegedly belonging to Rogers Communications, a Canadian company providing wireless, cable, and internet services.
Prescott College files a notice of data breach after the school learned that an unauthorized party had gained access to and removed certain files that were stored on its computer system.
Woodward Communications files a notice of data breach after experiencing a cybersecurity event that compromised the security of consumer data in the company’s possession.

The Chippewa County Human Resources Division notifies that the laptop computer of an employee was compromised and 25-35MB of data was stolen from the device, including information protected under HIPAA.
Target Class: Public admin and defence, social security

Author: LockBit 3.0
Target: Olympia CUSD (Olympia Community Unified School District 16)
Description: The LockBit 3.0 ransomware gang claims to have hit the Olympia CUSD (Olympia Community Unified School District 16) in Illinois, and post 4 files with personal information as proof.

Author: BlackCat
Description: The BlackCat ransomware gang claims to have breached Noteboom, a law firm.

Author: Medusa
Description: The Medusa ransomware gang claims responsibility for a cyberattack on the Open University of Cyprus (OUC), which caused severe disruptions of the organization's operations.
The UK's Criminal Records Office (ACRO) confirms that online portal issues experienced resulted from what it described as a "cyber security incident."
Target Class: Public admin and defence, social security

Description: Researchers from Avanan discover a series of campaign exploiting Quickbooks to harvest credentials.

Author: Muòtiple threat actors
Description: Adobe sends out password reset emails to users informing them that the company has changed the password associated with their Adobe ID, which may have been compromised in data breaches from other online sources. services.
Killer Instinct, a company that trades high-tech modern adaptations of the archaic long-range weapon, discloses a data breach affecting over 800 users.

Author: Cyber Resistance Group
Description: Hacktivists from the Pro-Ukraine Cyber Resistance Group break into the account of Putin supporter Mikhail Luchin, and spend  $25,000, the funds he had planned to use purchase Chinese drones on tens of thousands of dollars worth of dildos and strap-ons.

Target: University of Hawaii Maui College (UH Hawaii College)
Description: University of Hawaii Maui College (UH Hawaii College) posted notice of a data breach on its website following a February cyberattack.

Date Occurred: Between early November 2022 and Late February 2023
Description: Customers who purchased gift certificates from Thermea spa between early November and late February are told in an email that their credit card information may have been compromised, alongside their full names, phone numbers and email and street addresses.
Lending protocol Sentiment manages to recover the stolen funds from a recent hack by offering the hacker a bounty worth $95,000.

Author: LockBit 3.0
Description: The LockBit 3.0 ransomware gang claims to have breached OMS Components, an Italian company manufacturing office chairs components.

Author: ALPHV AKA BlackCat AKA UNC4466
Description: The BlackCat ransomware gang claims to have breached Electronic System, an Italian manufacturer of components for automations systems,

Author: Akira
Description: BridgeValley Community and Technical College suffers an Akira ransomware attck.

Author: For-profit companies
Description: The FBI warns that for-profit companies reportedly linked to sextortion activity are targeting victims using various deceptive tactics to pressure them into paying for "assistance" services.

Author: Balada Injector
Target: More than one million WordPress websites
Description: Researchers from Sucuri estimate that one million WordPress websites have been compromised during a long-lasting campaign that exploits "all known and recently discovered theme and plugin vulnerabilities" to inject a Linux backdoor via Balada Injector.

Author: Multiple threat actors
Description: Apple releases emergency security updates to address two new zero-day vulnerabilities (CVE-2023-28205 and CVE-2023-28206) exploited in attacks to compromise iPhones, Macs, and iPads.

Author: Multiple threat actors
Description: CISA adds CVE-2019-1388, a Microsoft Windows Certificate Dialog vulnerability to its list of exploited vulnerabilities.
CISA adds CVE-2023-26083, an information disclosure flaw in Arm Mali GPU Kernel Driver, exploited by a spyware vendor, to its list of exploited vulnerabilities.
The police department in Camden County, New Jersey confirmed that it was hit with a ransomware attack and is still investigating the incident.
Target Class: Public admin and defence, social security

Description: The Rochester Public Schools announces that it is canceling classes for all 42 schools it operates after it was hit by a suspected cyberattack.
Sarah D. Culbertson Memorial Hospital informs the public that staff had discovered a “network disruption” on March 30.
German drug development giant Evotec discloses it suffered a cyberattack that forced it to take all of its IT systems offline.

Author: MuddyWater (AKA MERCURY, Mango Sandstorm, Seedworm, and Static Kitten) and DEV-1084 (AKA Storm-1084)
Description: Researchers from Microsoft reveal that Iranian advanced persistent threat (APT) actors MuddyWater and DEV-1084 have been observed launching destructive cyberattacks disguised as ransomware against on-prem and cloud infrastructures.
The municipality of Herselt in Belgium has been hit by a cyberattack
Target Class: Public admin and defence, social security

Description: HawaiiUSA Federal Credit Union (HawaiiUSA) files a notice of data breach after a phishing incident leaks the personal information of more than 20,000 bank customers.

Target: Minnesota and Wisconsin locations of 90 Degree Benefits
Description: Minnesota and Wisconsin locations of 90 Degree Benefits files a notice of data breach after the company confirmed that certain files containing confidential consumer data were accessed by an unauthorized party following a cyberattack.
Baldor Specialty Foods files a notice of data breach after a malicious actor carried out a cyberattack against the company resulting in confidential consumer information being compromised.

La Clinica de La Raza files a notice of data breach after learning that certain employee email accounts containing confidential patient information were accessed by an unauthorized party over the course of a two-week period.
Charter Foods files a notice of data breach following a “criminal cyberattack” that compromised highly sensitive consumer information in the company’s possession
The U.S. Department of Health and Human Services (HHS) warns the healthcare sector of an ongoing DNS NXDOMAIN flood DDoS campaign.

Author: Abyss
Description: A leak site called “Abyss” adds 7×7 Dental Implant & Oral Surgery Specialists of San Francisco (7×7) to their site and claims to have leaked 114 GB of the dental practice’s files.

Aspire Public Schools submits notifications, according to which, it learned that an unauthorized party gained access to one Aspire email account at various times between February 2022 and August 2022.
The Kodi Foundation discloses a data breach after hackers stole the organization's MyBB forum database containing user data and private messages and attempted to sell it online.

Author: Money Message
Description: BrightSpring Health is listed among the victims of the Money Message ransomware in their leak site.

Author: Money Message
Description: PharMerica Corporation is listed among the victims of the Money Message ransomware in their leak site.

Author: Zarya
Description: Pro-Russia hacking group Zarya caused a cybersecurity incident at a Canadian gas pipeline

Author: FusionCore
Description: Researchers from Cyfirma discover a new cybercrime group, dubbed FusionCore, specialized in offering Malware-as-a-Service (MaaS) and other hacking services.

Target: Automated irrigation systems in the Jordan Valley
Description: In name of OpIsrael, automated irrigation systems in the Jordan Valley in Israel are briefly disrupted.
In name of OpIsrael, automated irrigation systems of Galil Sewage Corporation are briefly disrupted.
A bug on a smart contract on the decentralized finance (DeFi) protocol SushiSwap leads to over $3M in losses.
South Korean cryptocurrency exchange GDAC is the target of attackers, with the platform losing nearly $13M during the attack.
The Neue Zürcher Zeitung (NZZ) shuts down the newspaper production system after a ransomware attack.

Southern California’s San Bernardino County Sheriff’s Department says it experienced a “network disruption” to its electronic systems and has referred the problem to the FBI and Department of Homeland Security.
Target Class: Public admin and defence, social security

Author: BlackByte
Description: Cementos Bio-Bio, a Chilean cement company, is added to the BlackByte ransomware leaks site.

Author: Cyber Resistance
Target: Russian GRU officer Lieutenant Colonel Sergey Alexandrovich Morgachev
Description: Ukrainian hacktivist group Cyber Resistance claims to have hacked the email, social media, and personal accounts of Russian GRU officer Lieutenant Colonel Sergey Alexandrovich Morgachev, the alleged leader of the APT28 threat group (AKA Pawn Storm and Fancy Bear).
Target Class: Public admin and defence, social security

Description: Belgian HR and payroll giant SD Worx suffers a cyberattack causing them to shut down all IT systems for its UK and Ireland services.

Target: Chinese nationals based in the U.S.
Description: The FBI warns that cyber criminals posing as members of China’s government are targeting Chinese nationals based in the United States.

Target: Organizations in the financial sector in the U.S.
Description: Researchers from eSentire discover a new campaign deploying the malware loader known as GuLoader, targeting the US financial sector using phishing emails with a tax-themed lure.
A breach exposes the names and Social Security numbers of current and former Elmbrook School District employees.
Webster Bank files a notice of data breach after learning of a third-party data breach at Guardian Analytics, one of Webster Bank’s vendors.

Harrington Raceway and Casino files a notice of data breach with the Maine Attorney General after learning that hackers were able to access confidential consumer information located on the company’s servers for a period of two weeks.

Retina & Vitreous of Texas files a notice of data breach after learning that confidential patient information that had been entrusted to the company was accessible to unauthorized parties following a cybersecurity incident.
Stroud Area Regional Police Department (SARPD) announces that it has taken action after learning of a data security incident which may have impacted certain individuals' personal information.
Target Class: Public admin and defence, social security

Author: LockBit 3.0
Description: The Peruvian company Euromotors, a car dealership network, is added to the LockBit ransomware leak site.
WellBe Senior Medical joins the list of the victims of the CVE-2023-0669 Fortra GoAnywhere MFT Vulnerability.

Author: Russian threat actors
Description: The National Security Agency reveals that Russian threat actors have logged into private security cameras in Ukraine coffee shops to collect intelligence on aid convoys.

Target: At least five civil society victims in North America, Central Asia, Southeast Asia, Europe, and the Middle East
Description: Microsoft and Citizen Lab discover a commercial spyware made by an Israel-based company QuaDream used to compromise the iPhones of high-risk individuals using a zero-click exploit named ENDOFDAYS.

Author: Nokoyawa
Description: Microsoft patches CVE-2023-28252, a zero-day vulnerability in the Windows Common Log File System (CLFS), actively exploited by cybercriminals to escalate privileges and deploy the Nokoyawa ransomware payloads.

Target: Users speaking Japanese, Korean, and Spanish.
Description: Researchers from NTT discover a campaign where attackers are compromising websites to inject scripts that display fake Google Chrome automatic update errors that distribute malware to unaware visitors.
Hyundai discloses a data breach impacting Italian and French car owners and those who booked a test drive, warning that hackers gained access to personal data.

Cornwall Community Hospital, a healthcare facility serving the residents of Cornwall and several other counties in Canada, says it discovered a “network issue” that was later revealed to be a cyberattack.

Author: idklmao
Description: Researchers from Sonatype discover microsoft-helper, a malicious PyPI package, copycat of the popular W4SP stealer.

Author: SylexSquad
Description: Researchers from Sonatype discover reverse-shell, a PyPI package malware-as-a-service for the Spanish market.

Researchers from Veriti discover a campaign where attackers are posting what appear to be legitimate sponsored ads on hijacked Facebook business and community pages, which promise free downloads of AI chatbots such as ChatGPT and Google Bard and instead distribute the well-known, info-stealing malware RedLine Stealer.
Country: AR BD ES GR IN LB MX PK TO US

Description: Researchers from Fortinet discover a new multi-staged attack leveraging a malicious document spoofed to look like the Ukrainian state enterprise Energoatom, responsible for managing four nuclear power plants in Ukraine, and using the Havoc C2 framework to deliver multiple payloads at different stages.

Harding, Shymanski & Company files a notice of data breach after learning that an employee’s credentials were used to access customer 2021 tax returns, leading to fraudulent 2022 tax returns being filed on behalf of certain patients.

Author: BlackByte
Description: Data from the city of Collegedale is leaked after the city's computer systems were hacked by the BlackByte ransomware gang.
Target Class: Public admin and defence, social security

Author: Goldoson
Description: Researchers from McAfee discover a new Android malware named 'Goldoson' infiltrated on Google Play and ONE Store through 60 legitimate apps that collectively have 100 million downloads.

Author: Monti
Description: Security researchers warn that cybercriminals from the Monti ransomware group are using the Action1 remote access software for persistence on compromised networks and to execute commands, scripts, and binaries.

Date Occurred: During the first week of April 2023
Date Discovered: During the first week of April 2023
Description: Lürssen, a German manufacturer of military vessels and luxury yachts reportedly suffered a ransomware attack over the Easter holiday.

Author: Lazarus Group (AKA Labyrinth Collima, Covellite, UNC4034, Zinc, Nickel Academy)
Target: Multiple organizations in the cryptocurrency space
Description: Researchers from Kaspersky discover a new cluster of activity, dubbed DeathNote, part of the Operation DreamJob or NukeSped, carried out by the North Korean threat actor Lazarus Group.

Author: Anonymous Sudan
Target: Several hospitals and healthcare institutes in Hyderabad
Description: Anonymous Sudan targets several top hospitals and healthcare institutes in Hyderabad.

Author: Vixen Panda
Description: Chinese threat actors from Vixen Panda are suspected of allegedly targeting the Foreign Ministries in multiple countries in a new recent campaign.
Target Class: Public admin and defence, social security

Description: Unlimited Care files a notice of data breach after learning that a “network disruption” resulted in confidential employee information being compromised.

Author: Karakurt
Description: The Karakurt ransomware gang is back and adds Medicalodges to their leak site.

Author: Karakurt
Description: The Karakurt ransomware gang also adds Petaluma Health Center  to their leak site.

Author: LockBit 3.0
Description: The LockBit 3.0 ransomware gang claims to have breached Comacchio, an Italian drilling company, and as a proof dumps some data online.

Author: Cl0p AKA Clop
Description: Kannact discloses to have suffered a cyber attack, allegedly carried out by the Cl0p ransomware ganga exploiting the CVE-2023-0669 Fortra GoAnywhere MFT Vulnerability.

Author: U.S. and Other NATO Countries
Description: The Federal Security Service of the Russian Federation (FSB) accuses the United States and other NATO countries of launching over 5,000 cyberattacks against critical infrastructure in the country since the beginning of 2022.

Author: APT29 AKA Cozy Bear and NOBELIUM
Description: Poland's Military Counterintelligence Service and its Computer Emergency Response Team discover a campaign carried out by the APT29 state-sponsored threat actors, part of the Russian government's Foreign Intelligence Service (SVR), targeting NATO and European Union countries, via three malware samples dubbed  SNOWYAMBER, QUARTERRIG and HALFRIG.
Target Class: Public admin and defence, social security

Author: Forza Tools
Description: Researchers from Cado Security discover a new Python-based credential harvester and SMTP hijacking tool named ‘Legion’, sold on Telegram, and targeting online email services for phishing and spam attacks.

Author: Five Individuals
Description: Europol and Eurojust announce the arrest of five individuals believed to be part of a massive online investment fraud ring with at least 33,000 victims who lost an estimated €89 million (roughly $98 million).

Target: Accounting Firms and Tax Preparers in the U.S.
Description: With the end of the U.S. tax annual season reaching, Microsoft warns of a phishing campaign targeting accounting firms and tax preparers with the Remcos remote access malware allowing initial access to corporate networks.

Author: Vice Society
Description: Researchers from Palo Alto Networks reveal that the Vice Society ransomware gang is deploying a new, rather sophisticated PowerShell script to automate data theft from compromised networks.

Author: Chamaleon
Target: Android Banking Users in Australia and Poland
Description: Researchers from Cyble discover a new Android trojan called ‘Chameleon’, targeting users in Australia and Poland, mimicking the CoinSpot cryptocurrency exchange, an Australian government agency, and the IKO bank.
UK-based photo editing, graphic design and publishing software developer Affinity informs its forum members of a data breach.

Author: Read The Manual (RTM) Locker
Description: Researchers from Trellix detail the tactics, techniques, and procedures of an emerging cybercriminal gang called ‘Read The Manual (RTM) Locker. The group provides a ransomware-as-a-service (RaaS) and provides its malicious code to a network of affiliates by imposing strict rules.

Author: Killnet?
Description: German automotive and arms manufacturer Rheinmetall suffers a cyberattack. The Pro-Russia hacktivist group Killnet claims responsibility for the attack after the company's talks of constructing a new tank factory in Ukraine.

The U.S. Cybersecurity and Infrastructure Security Agency (CISA) warns CVE-2023-20963, of a high-severity Android vulnerability believed to have been exploited by the Chinese e-commerce app Pinduoduo as a zero-day to spy on its users.
The U.S. Cybersecurity and Infrastructure Security Agency (CISA) adds CVE-2023-29492, a Novi Survey Insecure Deserialization Vulnerability, to the list of its Known Exploited Vulnerabilities catalog.

Author: Multiple threat actors
Description: Google releases an emergency Chrome security update to address CVE-2023-2033, the first zero-day vulnerability exploited in attacks since the start of the year.
Singapore-based cryptocurrency trading platform Bitrue says that $23 million was stolen from one of its own digital wallets.

Author: Conti and FIN7
Description: Researchers from IBM discover a campaign distributing 'Minodo', a recently identified backdoor revealing a partnership between former members of the Conti ransomware group and the FIN7 financial criminal group.

Date Occurred: Since at least the end of March 2023
Author: APT36 AKA Transparent Tribe
Description: Researchers from Sentinel One discover a new campaign by the Pakistani threat actor known as APT36 or Transparent Tribe targeting the education sector in India with malicious Office documents distributing Crimson RAT.
Researchers from Avanan reveal that threat actors successfully impersonate Zelle to swipe money from unsuspecting users.

Author: Qbot AKA Qakbot, Pinkslipbot
Description: Researchers from AhnLab identify a new campaign distributing Qbot via malicious PDF files attached to replies or forwards to existing emails.
Decentralized Finance protcolo Yearn loses over $10M after attackers exploit a misconfiguration.
NationsBenefits Holding files a notice of data breach after learning that the company and its customers were affected by the third-party data breach at Fortra.

Author: LockBit 3.0
Description: Apro, a Chilean company that sells personal protection and industrial safety items, is added to LockBit’s leak site.

Author: BlackByte
Description: Mexico’s National Water Commission (Conagua), which manages, protects, and controls national waters in Mexico, is reportedly attacked by the BlackByte ransomware gang.

Author: Play
Description: The Play ransomware group threatens to dump personal and confidential data, projects and employee payroll information of Switzerland-based CH Media if its ransom demands are not met.
Caremar (Compagnia Regionale Marittima) has some data dumped in the XSS underground forum.

Researchers from Malwarebytes detect a specific malvertising campaign via Google ads aimed at seniors, where the actor creates hundreds of fake websites via the Weebly platform to host decoy content to fool search engines and crawlers while redirecting victims to a fake computer alert.

Researchers from Uptycs identify a new variant of credential stealing malware, dubbed Zaraza (Russian word for infection), using Telegram as its command and control and targeting a large number of web browsers.

Kimco Realty Corporation files a notice of data breach after a company Kimco had acquired, Weingarten Realty Investors, experienced a cyberattack resulting in confidential consumer data being exposed to unauthorized access.

United Steelworkers Local 286 files a notice of data breach after the organization learned that an unauthorized party had gained access to confidential member information through an employee’s compromised email account.
Two Rivers Public Health Department confirms that the protected health information of 15,168 patients was stored in an employee Office 365 account that was accessed by an unauthorized third party.
Target Class: Public admin and defence, social security

Description: The email addresses of thousands of MetaMask users who raised customer support tickets between Aug. 1 and Feb. 10 may have been compromised in a third-party cybersecurity incident suffered by the parent company ConsenSys.
Ethan Health confirms that the protected health information of 4,047 individuals was contained in employee email accounts that were accessed by unauthorized individuals.

Author: Electronic Tiger Unit
Target: SCADA water regulatory systems in Israel
Description: A hacktivist group known as "Electronic Tiger Unit" shares a screenshot on their Telegram channel, claiming to have accessed the SCADA water regulatory systems.

Author: ALPHV AKA BlackCat AKA UNC4466
Description: NCR suffers an outage on its Aloha point of sale platform after being hit by an ransomware attack claimed by the BlackCat/ALPHV gang.

Author: Vice Society
Description: Network infrastructure provider CommScope confirms that it suffered a ransomware attack and is investigating claims of stolen information leaked on the dark web by the Vice Society ransomware gang.
Multi-chain lending protocol Hundred Finance suffers a security breach, which results in the theft of approximately $7M worth of assets.
